description: Application of statistical methods to health care data. Descriptive statistics, including correlation and simple linear regression. Models that underlie inference will be examined, including laws of probability and probability distributions for dichotomous and continuous data. Confidence intervals for percentages and means and testing hypotheses using normal and chi square distributions.
name: INTRODUCTION TO STATISTICS

values.comments:
Application of statistical methods to health care data. Descriptive statistics,
including correlation and simple linear regression. Models that underlie inference are
examined, including laws of probability and probability distributions for dichotomous
and continuous data. Confidence intervals for percentages and means and testing
hypotheses using normal and chi square distributions.
This particular statistics course was more theoretical than mathematical. Many
students found the less quantitative course as comforting and easier to handle. The
textbook for the course very closely reflected the lecture material, making it easy to pick
up on any missed material in lecture.
Professor Tulman received mixed reviews. Some students enjoyed the Professor,
and others had a difficult time focusing on her lectures for the entire three-hour class, as
she was often unenthusiastic about the material.
The general consensus is that the course is not especially difficult. Tests were
rather described as “straightforward” and the work-load was considered manageable,
even when taken in conjunction with the anatomy requirement.
